api_list.api_description:
collect all parameteres, load the webpage and take screenshot at the end.
This API save on a S3 bucket and return the url.

optional_parameters.name: fullpage
optional_parameters.description: take screenshot of the entire website page, from header to footer

optional_parameters.name: removables
optional_parameters.description: remove divs/html by selector

optional_parameters.name: hasTouch
optional_parameters.description: Specify if the viewport supports touch events.

optional_parameters.name: clickSelector
optional_parameters.description: This method fetches an element with selector, scrolls it into view if needed, and then uses Page.mouse to click in the center of the element. If there's no element matching selector, the method throws an error.

optional_parameters.name: isFullyLoaded
optional_parameters.description:
consider navigation to be finished when there are no more than 0 network connections for at least 500 ms. 
Than take screenshot

optional_parameters.name: clickButton
optional_parameters.description: Mouse button to be used, left click or right click etc

optional_parameters.name: pageHeight
optional_parameters.description: Set browser page height

optional_parameters.name: isMobile
optional_parameters.description: Whether the meta viewport tag is taken into account.

optional_parameters.name: pageWidth
optional_parameters.description: Set browser page width

optional_parameters.name: isLandScape
optional_parameters.description: Specifies if the viewport is in landscape mode.

optional_parameters.name: deviceScaleFactor
optional_parameters.description: Specify device scale factor.

query: I'm in need of a screenshot tool. Can you provide me with a screenshot of 'https://www.example.com'? Please save the screenshot on a S3 bucket and ensure it captures the entire webpage. Additionally, remove any specified divs or elements from the screenshot.

Below Example: **Directions from a hospital in Koalack to Dakar**

optional_parameters.name: distance_unit
optional_parameters.description: Unit of distance measurement, valid options are **km** (default), and **mi**.

api_list.api_description:
This endpoint calculates the distance between two locations based on their latitude and longitude coordinates, while allowing the user to specify the unit of measurement.

Below Example: **Distance from a hospital in Koalack to Dakar**

optional_parameters.name: unit
optional_parameters.description: Unit of distance measurement, valid options are **km** (default), **mi**, **ft**, and **yd**.

api_list.api_description: This endpoint allows you to perform reverse geocoding in Senegal by providing query parameters for latitude and longitude. It returns the name of the city where the location is located.

This endpoint allows you to get facilities in Senegal like hospital, bank, college, etc. by providing optional query parameters for facility type, region and city. It returns a list of facilities that match the query parameters.

required_parameters.name: region
required_parameters.description: The region where the facility is located

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description:
The type of amenity facility to search for (default: **hospital**)
Options:
**aerodrome, bar, cafe, fast_food, pub, restaurant, college, driving_school, school, university, bank, atm, pharmacy,** etc..        

[More options->](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Map_features#Amenity)

optional_parameters.name: city
optional_parameters.description: The city where the facility is located

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The number of facilities to query.

api_list.api_description: This endpoint allows you to lookup locations in Senegal by providing an address query parameter. It returns the latitude, longitude and city name of the location.

required_parameters.name: address
required_parameters.description: he name of the location to look up.

optional_parameters.description: Return a team's specific season.

optional_parameters.name: season
optional_parameters.description: Return a team's specific season.

optional_parameters.name: expand
optional_parameters.description: Expand your response for some additional data.

api_list.api_description: You can use this to also retrieve inactive divisions. For example, the ID for the old Patrick division is `13`.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: The ID of the game. The first 4 digits identify the season of the game (ie. 2017 for the 2017-2018 season). The next 2 digits give the type of game, where 01 = preseason, 02 = regular season, 03 = playoffs, 04 = all-star. The final 4 digits identify the specific game number. For regular season and preseason games, this ranges from 0001 to the number of games played. (1271 for seasons with 31 teams (2017 and onwards) and 1230 for seasons with 30 teams). For playoff games, the 2nd digit of the specific number gives the round of the playoffs, the 3rd digit specifies the matchup, and the 4th digit specifies the game (out of 7).

optional_parameters.name: expand
optional_parameters.description: Expand your response for some additional data.

api_list.api_description: Returns domain status if is webmail or disposable.
The Enrichment API lets you look up person and company data based on an email, For example, you could retrieve a person’s name, location and social handles from an email

You can use this endpoint to show different browser icons to your users. The code argument receives the browser code as it appears in your user /account/sessions endpoint. Use width, height and quality arguments to change the output settings.

required_parameters.name: domain
required_parameters.description: Domain name from which you want to find the email addresses. For example, \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"stripe.com\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"

optional_parameters.name: department
optional_parameters.description: Get only email addresses for people working in the selected department(s).

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Specifies the number of email addresses to skip. The default is 1.

required_parameters.name: first_name
required_parameters.description: The person's first name. It doesn't need to be in lowercase.

required_parameters.name: last_name
required_parameters.description: The person's last name. It doesn't need to be in lowercase.

api_list.api_description: This endpoint will allow a user to get the data of a specific anime. It will take the anime's mal_id as a parameter and return the anime's data in JSON format. The data returned will include the anime's title, aired episodes, genre, and a brief synopsis.

optional_parameters.name: fields
optional_parameters.description:
Get the fields that you want.
Disponible fields:  

- * (to all data)
- id,
- title, 
- main_picture,
- start_date,
- end_data,
- synopsis,
- mean,
- rank,
- popularity,
- `num_list_users,`
- `num_scoring_users`,
- status,
- genres,
- num_episodes,
- source,
- studios,
- volume,
- chapter,
- light_novel,
- media_type,
- mal_id,
- broadcast,
- statistics,
- related_manga,
- related_anime,
- season,
- year,
- title_english,
- title_japanese,
- synonyms

api_list.api_description: This endpoint allows for the retrieval of data about anime. The query parameters include q (the search query), limit (the number of results per page), offset (the number of results to skip), ascending (sort order), order (sort order), `media_type `(anime type), studio (studio name), source (source material), status (`currently_airing `or `finished_airing`), genre, season, `year_equal `(equal to a year specified), `year_less `(less than a year specified), `year_greater `(greater than a year specified), language, and nsfw (not safe for work content).

optional_parameters.name: year_greater
optional_parameters.description: Find the animes with the year greater than the given one

optional_parameters.name: media_type
optional_parameters.description:
The media type of the anime.
They are:

- music,
- tv,
- ona,
- ova,
- movie,
- special

optional_parameters.name: studio
optional_parameters.description: Filter the animes by the studio

optional_parameters.name: year_less
optional_parameters.description: Find the animes with the year less than the given one

optional_parameters.name: nsfw
optional_parameters.description: Activate the nsfw content. If you don't want it, don't use it

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description:
Filter the animes by the actual status of the anime.

- currently_airing,
- finished_airing,
- ` not_yet_aired`

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the number of data recieved

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Search the anime title in english or japanase.

optional_parameters.name: genre
optional_parameters.description: Filter the animes by the genre

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Especify the order if asc or desc.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Recieve the data after the number of the offset.

optional_parameters.name: season
optional_parameters.description: Filter the animes by their season

optional_parameters.name: fields
optional_parameters.description:
Get the fields that you want.
Disponible fields:  

- * (to all data)
- id,
- title, 
- main_picture,
- start_date,
- end_data,
- synopsis,
- mean,
- rank,
- popularity,
- `num_list_users,`
- `num_scoring_users`,
- status,
- genres,
- num_episodes,
- source,
- studios,
- volume,
- chapter,
- light_novel,
- media_type,
- mal_id,
- broadcast,
- statistics,
- related_manga,
- related_anime,
- season,
- year,
- title_english,
- title_japanese,
- synonyms

optional_parameters.name: year_equal
optional_parameters.description: Filter the anime by the year release

optional_parameters.name: source
optional_parameters.description:
Filter the anime by the source.
They are:

- manga,
- visual_novel,
- novel,
- `4_koma_manga`,
- book,
- card_game,
- game,
- light_novel,
- mixed_media,
- music,
- novel,
- original,
- web_manga,
- web_novel,
- visual_novel,
- picture_book,
- other

optional_parameters.name: order
optional_parameters.description: Order the data with the field tha you want
